chapter.title: Getting Started
chapter.para: This section describes how to start the Java Broker for the first time.

section.title: Starting/Stopping the Broker
section.para: To start the Broker, use the qpid-server script (UNIX) or qpid-server.bat (Windows) provided within distribution.

section.title: Starting/Stopping on Windows
section.para: Firstly change to the installation directory used during the installation and ensure that the QPID_WORK environment variable is set.
Now use the qpid-server.bat to start the server

section.title: Log file
section.para: The Java Broker writes a log file to record both details of its normal operation and any exceptional conditions. By default the log file is written within the log subdirectory beneath the work directory - $QPID_WORK/log/qpid.log (UNIX) and %QPID_WORK%\log\qpid.log (Windows).
For details of how to control the logging, see

section.title: Using the command line
section.para: The Java Broker understands a number of command line options which may be used to override the configuration.
To see usage information for all command line options, use the option --help
